title: [$250] Reports - When search result is group-by:from, selection mode auto exits after holding expense

labels.name: External

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.16-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70176 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dhjjjjopllmlpppppp@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 15 Pro Max / iOS 26.0 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch Expensify app. 2. Open 1:1 DM. 3. Submit two expenses to the user. 4. Go to Reports > Menu > Reports. 5. Expand the report. 6. Long tap on the expense report > Select. 7. Select one of the expenses. 8. Tap dropdown button > Hold. 9. Enter reason and save it. → Selection mode persists after holding expense on Reports. 10. Change the search query to group-by:from and search. 11. Expand the user row. 12. Long tap on the expense report > Select. 13. Select the unheld expense. 14. Tap dropdown button > Hold. 15. Enter reason and save it. ## Expected Result: After holding expense when search result is group-by:from, the selection mode will persist. ## Actual Result: After holding expense when search result is group-by:from, the selection mode exits, which is different from when the search result is group-by:report (Step 9). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/69be6dba-e11e-4e86-8eb7-12de89488e0d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Removal of deprecated gestureHandlerRootHOC

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem: We are currently using `gestureHandlerRootHOC` in ValidateCodeForm, which was added there to resolve the issue of the number fields on the new contact method not being clickable on Android. The issue is that `gestureHandlerRootHOC` has been deprecated for two months and will be removed in the future version of Gesture Handler. ### Solution: Let's move away from it and use the suggested GestureHandlerRootView instead. Lets make sure the issue that was a reason to introduce this remains fixed https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/51293#issuecomment-2469664545

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.16-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 18.5 Safari **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new gmail account with + 2. Create a workspace, verify that the workspace tasks appear in the Concierge chat 3. Delete the workspace 4. Navigate to the Concierge chat 5. Click on the links in the tasks like "Review your workspace settings" or "Create a workspace" - "Not here" page shown 6. Create a new workspace and repeat step 5 ## Expected Result: The workspace tasks are removed from the Concierge chat after deleting the workspace. Like when you sign in with a gmail account without +, the workspace tasks are deleted along with the #admins after deleting the workspace, and do not reappear after creating a new workspace. ## Actual Result: The workspace tasks are still present in the Concierge chat after deleting the workspace, the links lead to "Not here" page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5e37bf47-69ab-41fc-be46-f605ab9ff0bf [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Open the Expensify app 2. Tap on FAB and select "Create Expense" 3. Enter any amount and tap on "Next" 4. Note that default workspace on "To" field, shows "Submits to XX" as subtitle 5. Tap on the "To" field to open the recipient selection page 6. Note that selected workspace subtitle now displays "Workspace" as subtitle 7. Search for another workspace on the list 8. Note that subtitle changed to "Workspace" ## Expected Result: When selecting a workspace during expense creation flow, subtitle on workspace preview, should remain the same after seleted ## Actual Result: Subtitle message on workspace preview, during expense creation flow, changes from "Submits to XX" to "Workspace" after selection ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Automatically create a Markdown link when highlighting text and pasting a link

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from [this discussion](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1753136093215399) ### Background It's a common pattern that when a clipboard has a link copied to it and the user paste into a text window the link will be automatically formatted to hyperlink the selected text using markdown syntax (if the text window uses markdown syntax). Expensify currently allows markdown syntax in it's text window for chats, and we have keyboard shortcuts for making italics and bolding, but we do not have the equivalent for markdown links. ### Problem When users are use to markdown and expect the text window to work like other markdown compatible text windows (Slack, Github, etcetera) and it doesn't behave similarly it creates confusion and an appearance that our application is not feature complete. ### Solution Automatically replace text with a Markdown link when highlighting text and pasting a link. Example: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caf857d2-ee30-446d-80cb-7d040959d10f
